thread.title: 19 best drugstore moisturizers to buy now, according to beauty editors
thread.title_full: 19 best drugstore moisturizers to buy now, according to beauty editors - TODAY.com

author: Colleen Sullivan
title: 19 best drugstore moisturizers to buy now, according to beauty editors

organizations.name: st. ives skin renewing collagen elastin body lotion
jergens natural glow wet skin moisturizer
curel hydra therapy wet skin moisturizer
martha steward living and martha stewart weddings

text:
One perk of being a beauty editor: You get to test out all the latest (and greatest!) beauty and skin care products. So, who better to ask then a bunch of top editors for their favorite hydrating body moisturizers?
Closed Captioning ON OFF apply | reset x Text Display Background Enhancements font
Times New Roman Arial Comic Sans size
T T T T color
share link 8 top drugstore skin-care products revealed by TODAY, People magazine Play Video - 4:30 8 top drugstore skin-care products revealed by TODAY, People magazine Play Video - 4:30 More video 0:55 Sponsored Content Now Playing Fresh start? Try a fresh-faced beauty routine 5:47 Sponsored Content Now Playing Better Than Sex mascara, Living Proof hair spray, more: Must-have beauty aids 4:21 Sponsored Content Now Playing Hair and makeup trends to watch in 2017 (no more contouring!) 0:59 Sponsored Content Now Playing Why I love my 'masculine' eyebrows just as they are Check out their favorite budget-friendly finds that are all available at your local drugstore!
RELATED: See the full list of winners from the TODAY and People Beauty Awards
1. Yes To Carrots Super Rich Body Butter, $10, Walmart
Walgreens "I use a lot of different body lotions and butters, but this body butter is ideal for those moments when you really need to be cocooned in moisture. Once you put it on, your skin is plump, dewy and feels pampered ‚Äî and if you're going to take the time out of your day to apply body butter, isn't that how you want to feel? I would be remiss if I didn't discuss the scent: Pay no mind to the name; you won't smell like carrots. This leaves your skin with a light, clean-yet-sweet scent. Like all Yes To products, this is approved by Leaping Bunny, which is fast becoming the leading authority on cruelty-free products. I love progressive body butter!" said Jessica Matlin, beauty and health director of Teen Vogue.
My definition of luxury: loads of bedding; elastic-waist pants; Janetta, my Siberian Forest Cat by my side; and triple-thick moisturizers! One of my favorites: @yestocarrots Super Rich Body Butter. (I love that they're @leapingbunnyprogram -approved.) üíñüê∞#yestocarrots #drugstore #drugstorediamonds
A photo posted by Jessica Matlin (@jessicamatlin) on Jan 8, 2017 at 8:08am PST
2. Dove Dry Oil Moisture Body Wash, $7, Target
Target ‚ÄúFor those times when I don‚Äôt have a spare minute to slather on body cream and wait for it to dry ‚Äî or the desire to shiver sans clothes! ‚Äî I turn to this body wash. Yes, body wash. The insanely rich, pudding-esque formula contains a trio of natural oils (argan, soybean, and sunflower) that actually leave skin noticeably softer after you rinse and dry off. And it‚Äôs not just my imagination: the Good Housekeeping Beauty Lab‚Äôs moisturization test found that this body wash alone hydrated skin for four hours, no lotion needed. Oh, and it smells like it should cost five times as much ‚Äî musky and warm, like a fancy perfume ‚Äî but the bottle is so huge I can slather it on without guilt,‚Äù said April Franzino, beauty director of Good Housekeeping.
Here is a photo of me awkwardly posing with @dove body wash üòú Why, coming soon! üíã#ghbeauty
A photo posted by April Franzino (@aprilfranzino) on Jan 5, 2017 at 11:01am PST
3. Vaseline Essential Healing Intensive Care Spray Moisturizer, $6.50, CVS
CVS "While I love a good lotion or cream, the ease of this spray-on formula can‚Äôt be beat. It goes on lightly, dries pretty quickly and doesn‚Äôt get all over the floor (like some other sprays do). No mess, no stress. Bonus: The subtle scent doesn‚Äôt compete with my fragrance," said Dori Katz, beauty and fashion director of Family Circle.
My first ever #wcw goes to: @christiebrinkley. If only I can look this good at 60- here's to hoping!
A photo posted by Dori Price (@dorable6) on Nov 19, 2014 at 7:03am PST
4. Burt's Bees Nourishing Baby Oil, $9, Walmart
Walmart "I find body oils to be much easier to apply than lotions or creams. They dry just as quickly ‚Äî if not quicker ‚Äî and instantly warm in your hands. This body oil has a lush apricot scent and a rich texture. And it happens to be for ... babies. I discovered it when I had my first child, when I was looking for something without phthalates or SLS. Of course, you can use it on anyone (most of all yourself), and you can pour it in the bath or put it directly on the body. There is a version for adults, but I prefer the scent of this one. I always keep it in the shower so I never forget to apply," said Jamie Rosen, beauty director of Town & Country.
RELATED: 17 drugstore face masks celebrity experts love
5. DJ Khaled x Palmer's ‚ÄúWE THE BEST GLOW‚Äù Cocoa Butter Formula, $6.50, Palmers.com
Palmers.com "Full disclosure: I'm not a body lotion fan. The formulas I tried left my skin feeling sticky. Then, I stumbled upon this moisturizer. First, I fell in love with the cocoa butter scent (think chocolate chip cookies but not too sweet), then I fell in love with the results. The vitamin E goodness sinks in fast, transforms my scales into silky, almost model-worthy skin and takes away that tight, itchy feeling I get on my lower back come wintertime. This limited-edition bottle is a collab with hip-hop mogul DJ Kaled who claims, "it's a major key" to soft skin," said Heather Muir, beauty director of Real Simple and Health.
6. Jergens Oil-Infused Moisturizer with Nourishing Monoi Oil, $5, Target
Target "Like magic, this luxe (without the bucks) body moisturizer turns my scaly winter skin into soft, smooth and sleek (read: slimmer and firmer-looking!). I slather it on my legs, arms and d√©collet√© before a big night out. The formula packs the power of classic Jergens lotion, but with the added addition of monoi oil, a scent that transports me back to a holiday on the island of Oahu ‚Äî sans the business class plane ticket price!" said Gwen Flamberg, beauty director of US Magazine.
Just a couple of outer borough girls sharing beauty secrets and a smile! #nofilter (really!) #wcw #jlovegas #jlustbyjlo üíú
A photo posted by Gwen Flamberg (@gwen_beauty) on Jun 15, 2016 at 9:51am PDT
7. AmLactin Moisturizing Body Lotion, $12.49, Target
Target "I could easily spend 20 minutes massaging in serums and lotions on my face, but I‚Äôm very, very lazy when it comes to skin below the neck. For this reason, I only use body hydrators that make a noticeable and speedy difference. And this one truly does just that. It‚Äôs infused with alpha hydroxy acids and softening glycerin, which together slough away the flaky, dead cells and quench the fresh ones underneath with moisture. I slather it on at night and wake up with skin that‚Äôs almost unrecognizable‚Äîit‚Äôs that soft, and that devoid of rough patches and bumps. ‚ÄîMaura Lynch, Beauty & Lifestyle Director at Women‚Äôs Health
8. Eucerin Intensive Repair Lotion, $12.59, Walgreens
Walgreens "This body moisturizer might be the one beauty product I can‚Äôt live without. I‚Äôve been using it for years and it‚Äôs the only thing that works for my dry skin. It‚Äôs rich and thick, yet it doesn‚Äôt leave behind a greasy residue. I put it on in the morning and it keeps my skin hydrated all day," said Kahlana Barfield Brown, fashion and neauty editor at large for InStyle.
Dylan's mommy. #InStyleGlobes || Dress: @estebancortazarofficial @theoutnet Hair: @cynthiaglam Makeup: @sirjohnofficial üì∏: @erikumphery
A photo posted by Kahlana Barfield Brown (@kahlanabarfield) on Jan 8, 2017 at 4:35pm PST
9. Jergens Original Scent Dry Skin Moisturizer, $4, Target
Target "This moisturizer is my ride-or-die. I have a jumbo size (plus a backup!) in my bathroom, and am never without my purse-size mini. It hydrates like crazy, but there‚Äôs an emotional tie, too. My grandmother ‚Äî whom I‚Äôd never met ‚Äî wore it non-stop and passed it to my mother, who then passed it to me; a beauty heirloom, if you will. Now when I smell that soft, comforting scent, I‚Äôm reminded of memories from my own life: getting ready for my first high-school formal with my friend Anne, sharing it with my sorority sisters jam-packed in a tiny bathroom, moisturizing my hands on my first date with my husband, applying it in the hospital before holding my son for the first time. Budget-friendly as it may be, its scent memories are priceless," said Leah Wyar, executive beauty director of Cosmopolitan and Seventeen.
Celebrating @seventeen's first-ever Body Confidence Day with a pic that shows me carefree and loving life (in my home state of PA!). Share your #PerfectlyMe moment and tag us...we'll be RG'ing them all month!
A photo posted by Leah Wyar Romito üíÑ Cosmo + 17 (@leahwyar) on Oct 17, 2016 at 6:50pm PDT
10. Palmer‚Äôs Cocoa Butter Formula Original Solid, $3.50, Walmart
Walmart "I‚Äôm completely obsessed with this body butter, specifically the one that comes in the jar. I grew up on this glorious stuff and I can‚Äôt remember not having it in my home. Ashy, dry skin is no match for the thick and creamy formula. It‚Äôs 100 percent amazing!" said Julee Wilson, fashion and beauty director of Essence.
11. Curel Hydra Therapy Wet Skin Moisturizer, $11, Walmart
Walmart "My skin is extremely needy this time of year. If I skip lotion for more than a day or two, there‚Äôs suddenly a rough, dry, bumpy revolt happening south of my neck. The trouble is that once I‚Äôm out of the shower, mom duty calls and it‚Äôs a mad dash to get dressed and deal with the kids. Too late to moisturize!
"Now I slather on this in-shower formula as soon as I turn off the water ‚Äî it takes 30 seconds tops ‚Äî and then wrap myself in a towel. The formula defies logic: it's deceptively lightweight, doesn‚Äôt have a cloying scent and hydrates over the course of the day just as well as the thick creams I‚Äôve used in the past (i.e. before kids). It‚Äôs a low-maintenance solution to my high-maintenance skin and life," said Erica Metzger, beauty and fashion director of Better Homes and Gardens.
All the cliches are true. When you have wee ones afoot, the shower is your only sanctuary! My current faves: Curel Hydra Therapy and Soap & Glory Clean On Me. @curelus @soapandgloryusa
A photo posted by Erica Metzger (@embeautycoach) on Jan 10, 2017 at 5:39pm PST
12. Neutrogena Body Oil, $9.49, Walmart
Walmart "This divine sesame body oil cannot be beat. The whole beauty world has gone batty for oils recently, but they were ahead of the curve with this product. Not only does it smell great and sink right into your skin, you can also add it to your bath for extra moisture. I even use it in place of shaving cream," said Erin Flaherty, beauty director of Marie Claire.
More Style videos 4:29 Sponsored Content Now Playing Gingham prints, yellow hues, low-block heels: 2017 fashion trends for everyone 0:55 Sponsored Content Now Playing Fresh start? Try a fresh-faced beauty routine 6:01 Sponsored Content Now Playing ‚ÄòPatti LaBelle, step back!‚Äô See this woman glow after glamorous Ambush Makeover 4:16 Sponsored Content Now Playing Jewelry holders, leather pouches and other Steals and Deals to organize your life 13. Aveeno Daily Moisturizing Lotion, $8.50, Walgreens
Walgreens "I know I could get my beauty editor membership revoked for saying this, but I‚Äôve never been a fan of body lotion. The three minutes it takes to absorb feels like an eternity, especially on a rushed weekday morning when I need that time to curl my hair (priorities!). But a big bottle of this moisturizing lotion is always on our bathroom counter. Why? Because my boyfriend has been using it for years (Sidebar: men are crazy loyal to products). I recently applied a few pumps to my legs out of curiosity and didn‚Äôt even have to wait a minute for it to sink in. It‚Äôs unscented so my perfume doesn‚Äôt have any competition and it made my legs feel extra-smooth," said Andrea Lavinthal, style and beauty director of People.
üç™üòç #Emmys
A photo posted by Andrea Lavinthal (@andilavs) on Sep 20, 2015 at 3:51pm PDT
14. St. Ives Skin Renewing Collagen Elastin Body Lotion, $5, Jet.com
CVS "I‚Äôm very picky when it comes to body lotion. The formula and texture have to be creamy and hydrating, but not too oily or greasy. I love this lightweight formula because 1) it isn‚Äôt sticky, 2) it contains both collagen and elastin, ingredients known to give skin a youthful glow, and 3) it has a fresh but totally non-cloying scent. I also think anything that comes in a pump is genius because it‚Äôs less messy," said Jacqueline Gifford, special projects editor, Travel + Leisure.
15. Jergens Wet Skin Moisturizer, $7, Walmart
Walgreens "I'll often layer four or five serums and lotions on my face ‚Äî sometimes more than once a day. But I'm really really lazy about moisturizing my body. In the winter (when I need the hydration most), I just want to wrap myself in a fluffy robe as soon as I step out of the shower. I love this magic formula because I can apply it, in about 30 seconds, to my damp skin right after I turn off the water. It contains emulsifiers that let its hydrating oils combine with the water on your body and absorb quickly. So I can immediately snuggle up in that robe and still have silky limbs all winter," said Jenny Bailly, beauty director of Allure.
it's the most wonderful time of the year: getting a sneak peek at next year's @flowerbeauty goodies and my annual #drewfie @drewbarrymore is one of the most passionate beauty moguls out there (and her mascara is putting mine to shame here) #yesterdaygram
A photo posted by Jenny Bailly (@jbailly) on Dec 8, 2016 at 10:51am PST
RELATED: Allure magazine spills the hottest hair and makeup trends of 2017
16. Jergens Natural Glow Wet Skin Moisturizer, $9, Walmart
Walmart "A little secret about beauty editors: We don‚Äôt always follow our own advice. Case in point: body lotion. I know I‚Äôm not the only one who skips this step each morning, so in-shower moisturizers are a game-changer for me. Smooth this one on damp skin before leaving the shower, and voila, you‚Äôre done. Plus, there's the added benefit of a gradual tanner to counter balance my ghostly pale limbs," said Melissa Goldstein, beauty director of Martha Steward Living and Martha Stewart Weddings.
Totally nonchalantly hanging out in my shower with the greatest in-shower #moisturizer @jergensus Natural Glow #wetskinmoisturizer. Particularly useful this time of year when my legs have turned a ghostly shade of rigor mortis. #drugstorebeauty #gradualtanner #fauxtan #hydrate #marthabeauty
A photo posted by Melissa Goldstein (@goldnyc) on Jan 8, 2017 at 8:44pm PST
17. Aveeno Skin Relief Gentle Scent Lotion in Nourishing Coconut, $10, Walgreens
Walgreens "The light texture is great: fast-absorbing, but really hydrating. It has the nicest coconut fragrance ‚Äî but not so strong that you worry people are going to stick a cocktail umbrella in you!" said Brian Underwood, beauty director for "Dr. Oz, The Good Life"
@vanna59 and I are obsessed with the smell of this @aveenous body lotion. It's coconut-y but in the nicest, most subtle way evaaahh. #drozbeauty #drugstorebeauty #moisturizer #bodylotion #aveeno
A photo posted by Brian Underwood (@briguy0618) on Jan 5, 2017 at 2:49pm PST
18. Vaseline Intensive Care Healing Serum Advanced Relief Body Lotion, $9, Walgreens
Walgreens "I‚Äôm finicky when it comes to my body lotion: It has to be super-hydrating because my skin gets really dry, especially this time of year, but it also has to sink in right away because I can‚Äôt stand it when my skin feels all slick afterwards. I also don‚Äôt like much of a scent, otherwise it throws off the perfume I wear every day. This formula contains tiny droplets of the original Vaseline jelly, which you think would make it greasy, but it doesn‚Äôt at all. It goes on nice and smooth ‚Äî it has the consistency of a more lightweight lotion ‚Äî and absorbs in a minute flat," said Victoria Kirby, beauty director of Redbook.
RELATED: What's the best-selling mascara? Redbook has the answer
Thanks @vaselinebrand Intensive Care Healing Serum body lotion for saving my butt (and arms, legs, et al) on this arctic-cold day. ‚ùÑÔ∏è‚ùÑÔ∏è(And no, this isn't sponsored‚ÄîI'm not popular enough for that.)
A photo posted by Victoria Kirby (@victoriahkirby) on Jan 9, 2017 at 3:04pm PST
19. Nivea Nourishing Body Oil, $12, CVS
CVS "I use body oil like it‚Äôs going out of style; my dry skin just soaks up all of its goodness. The scent is pleasant but not overpowering and leaves your skin super soft but not greasy. I apply it fresh out of the shower for optimal absorption and sometimes follow with body cream since I am a true moisture fiend! Since I go through bottles upon bottles, this affordable option is much appreciated," said Holly Carter, beauty director at StyleWatch.
